solution_line_template: Geordie pays {car_toll_cost} * {car_drive_days} = $<<{car_toll_cost}*{car_drive_days}={car_tolls_cost}>>{car_tolls_cost} for car tolls driving to work three times a week.

He pays {motorcycle_toll_cost} * {motorcycle_drive_days} = $<<{motorcycle_toll_cost}*{motorcycle_drive_days}={motorcycle_tolls_cost}>>{motorcycle_tolls_cost} for motorcycle tolls driving to work twice a week.
He drives {commute_distance} * {work_days_per_week} = <<{commute_distance}*{work_days_per_week}={total_commute_miles_one_way}>>{total_commute_miles_one_way} miles to work each five-day workweek.
He uses {total_commute_miles_one_way} / {miles_per_gallon} = <<{total_commute_miles_one_way}/{miles_per_gallon}={gallons_used_one_way}>>{gallons_used_one_way} gallons of gas on the drive.
He spends {gas_cost_per_gallon} * {gallons_used_one_way} = $<<{gas_cost_per_gallon}*{gallons_used_one_way}={gas_cost_one_way}>>{gas_cost_one_way} on gas each week.

Thus, he spends {car_tolls_cost} + {motorcycle_tolls_cost} + {gas_cost_one_way} = $<<{car_tolls_cost}+{motorcycle_tolls_cost}+{gas_cost_one_way}={total_cost_one_way}>>{total_cost_one_way} driving to work.
Since he drives to work and back from work, he spends {total_cost_one_way} * {round_trip_factor} = $<<{total_cost_one_way}*{round_trip_factor}={total_weekly_cost}>>{total_weekly_cost} a week.
